alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 9:14PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Phillips, Petroleum and southwestern Garfield Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 914 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Hays to Winnett. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winnett, Zortman, U L Bend Rec Area, Mosby, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Landusky, Cat Creek and Tiegen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips
